Class FractalPanel

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • FractalPanel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class FractalPanel
extends javax.swing.JPanel
    The panel which displays the Mandelbrot set itself and contains all the calculations related to it.
    Author:
    Daniel
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  FractalPanel.FractalMouseListener
      Used when the user is zooming in to calculate points and create the zoom box to be shown on screen.

      Complex calculatePoint(int x, int y)
      Calculates the real and imaginary parts of a complex number from a point on the screen given.
      void changeIterations(int max)
      Changes the maximum number of iterations to try in the Mandelbrot Set and redraws the Mandelbrot set.
      java.awt.image.BufferedImage getFractal()
      Allows the buffered image of the fractal to be accessed.
      int getFractalType()
      Returns the number equivalent of the fractal type being displayed on the screen.
      void pixelValues(int height, int width)
      Calculates the value of each pixel in both the x and y axis' and calculates the coordinates of the middle of the Panel.
      void setAnimate(boolean animate)
      Changes the option to use zoom animations or not.
      void setFractalType(int fractalType)
      Sets the type of fractal that should be displayed on screen.
      void setThread(int i)
      Changes the thread option to be used to the given integer.

      Updates the values for the plane, both imaginary and real, recalculates the value in the centre of the screen and redraws the Mandelbrot set using these new values.

      Finds the real number equivalent of an x pixel value and returns it.

      Finds the imaginary number equivalent of a y pixel value and returns it.

    • Constructor Detail

      • FractalPanel

        public FractalPanel()
        Creates a Default FractalPanel with default values for max, realAxis and imaginaryAxis. Adds the mouse listener for zooming, and sets default values for the thread type, fractal type and sets to use zoom animations.

    • Method Detail

      • setFractalType

        public void setFractalType(int fractalType)
        Sets the type of fractal that should be displayed on screen.
        Parameters:
        fractalType - An int representation of the fractal type.

      • getFractalType

        public int getFractalType()
        Returns the number equivalent of the fractal type being displayed on the screen.
        Returns:
        int equivalent of fractal type.

      • getFractal

        public java.awt.image.BufferedImage getFractal()
        Allows the buffered image of the fractal to be accessed.
        Returns:
        The fractal buffered image.

      • pixelValues

        public void pixelValues(int height,
               int width)
        Calculates the value of each pixel in both the x and y axis' and calculates the coordinates of the middle of the Panel.
        Parameters:
        height - The height of the JPanel.
        width - The width of the JPanel.

      • xValue

        public double xValue(int x)
        Finds the real number equivalent of an x pixel value and returns it.
        Parameters:
        x - The x pixel value.
        Returns:
        The real number.

      • yValue

        public double yValue(int y)
        Finds the imaginary number equivalent of a y pixel value and returns it.
        Parameters:
        y - The y pixel value.
        Returns:
        The imaginary number.

      • updatePlane

        public void updatePlane(double xLower,
               double xUpper,
               double yLower,
               double yUpper)
        Updates the values for the plane, both imaginary and real, recalculates the value in the centre of the screen and redraws the Mandelbrot set using these new values.
        Parameters:
        xLower - The lower bound of the real axis.
        xUpper - The upper bound of the real axis.
        yLower - The lower bound of the imaginary axis.
        yUpper - The upper bound of the imaginary axis.

      • changeIterations

        public void changeIterations(int max)
        Changes the maximum number of iterations to try in the Mandelbrot Set and redraws the Mandelbrot set.
        Parameters:
        max - The maximum number of iterations.

      • calculatePoint

        public Complex calculatePoint(int x,
                     int y)
        Calculates the real and imaginary parts of a complex number from a point on the screen given.
        Parameters:
        x - The x co-ordinate of the screen point.
        y - The y co-ordinate of the screen point.
        Returns:
        The Complex number equivalent of the given screen point.

      • setThread

        public void setThread(int i)
        Changes the thread option to be used to the given integer.
        Parameters:
        i - The int representation of the thread type given.

      • setAnimate

        public void setAnimate(boolean animate)
        Changes the option to use zoom animations or not.
        Parameters:
        animate - The boolean option.
